strongs_def: a present (as offered up), especially in sacrifice or as tribute
clamor, i.e. acclamation of joy or a battle-cry; especially clangorof trumpets, as an alarum
kjv_def: alarm, blow(-ing) (of, the) (trumpets), joy, jubile, loud noise, rejoicing, shout(-ing), (high, joyful) sound(-ing).

derivation: from H7322 (רוּף) in the sense of its congener H7495 (רָפָא);

strongs_def: a species of tree (apparently from its slenderness), perhaps the cypress
Terach, the father of Abraham; also a place in the Desert

derivation: and תַּרְמוּת; or תַּרְמִית; from H7411 (רָמָה);

strongs_def: a pole (as a mast or flagstaff)
a door; by implication, a palace
a Tirathite or inhabitant of an unknown Tirah
derivation: patrial from an unused name meaning gate;

strongs_def: Teraphim (singular or plural) a family idol
Tirtsah, a place in Palestine; also an Israelitess
Tarshish, a place on the Mediterranean, hence, the ephithet of a merchant vessel (as if for or from that port); also the name of a Persian and of an Israelite
derivation: probably the same as H8658 (תַּרְשִׁישׁ) (as the region of the stone, or the reverse);

strongs_def: Tirshatha, the title of a Persian deputy or governor
Tartak, a deity of the Avvites
a Tishbite or inhabitant of Tishbeh (in Gilead)
derivation: patrial from an unused name meaning recourse;

strongs_def: a recurrence (of time or place); a reply (as returned)
rescue (literal or figurative, persons, national or spiritual)
derivation: or תְּשֻׁעָה; from H7768 (שָׁוַע) in the sense of H3467 (יָשַׁע);
from H7783 (שׁוּק) in the original sense of stretching out after;
from H7788 (שׁוּר) in the sense of arrival;
or (masculine) תִּשְׁעָה; perhaps from H8159 (שָׁעָה) through the idea of a turn to the next or full number ten;
